document_data.caption: Kelgantor, bravely hanging back behind a tree (wands sold separately)
document_data.name: Kelgantor
document_data.mainbody: '''Kelgantor''' was a [[War Wizard]] of [[Cormyr]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Personality: Kelgantor was decisive, and coldly ruthless.
document_data.Possessions: During the [[Tethgard]] raid, he was wielding two [[enchanted]] [[wand]]s.
document_data.Activities: He was a War Wizard commander, often sent on killing missions.
document_data.Relationships: According to the Royal Magician [[Ganrahast Aeiulvana]], the War Wizards sent on the Tethgard raid were Kelgantor's "wolves".{{cite book/Elminster Must Die/MMP|12|1}} Those so-called wolves included [[Rorskryn Mreldrake]], [[Shuldroon]], [[Tethlor]], [[Therlon]], and [[Hondryn]].
document_data.History:
Kelgantor was a veteran War Wizard. On [[Mirtul 5]] of the {{yearlinkName|1479}}, when Ganrahast sent him after [[Elminster Aumar]], a fugitive wizard who had just stolen the ''[[Royal Gorget of Battle]]''. Kelgantor brought a large retinue of wizards and [[highknights]] with him to [[Tethgard]], where Elminster had been tracked; unknown to him, [[Storm Silverhand]], an accomplice of Elminster's, had managed to sneak up on his squad at the last moment, knocking out Highknight [[Eskrel Starbridge]]. Nonetheless, they were able to sneak up on Elminster, who was accompanied by the former Queen of [[Aglarond]], the mad sorceress known as [[the Simbul]].

He stood back, took cover, and readied two wands, leaving the parley to Shuldroon, who stalled for a very long time, before striking. The combined spells and the [[wild magic]] at Tethgard caused their attacks to lead to an immense explosion, which soon blew up the ruins. Kelgantor, despite standing back, was decapitated by a fragment.
